name: Analysis Stratum

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of the human species.
term: Race

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: The assemblage of properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female.
term: Sex

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: A characterization or categorization of the tobacco product.
term: Tobacco Product Category

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: The usage status of a tobacco product(s) after a change in use of any tobacco product(s).
term: Post-Transition Tobacco Product Use Status

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: The usage status of a tobacco product(s) prior to a change in use of any tobacco product(s).
term: Pre-Transition Tobacco Product Use Status

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: The condition or status of usage of a tobacco product(s).
term: Tobacco Product Use Status

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: A characterization or categorization of the change from one tobacco product use state to another.

name: Analysis Stratum
definition: A year period of time, which may be historical or projected, that is used for the purpose of defining a projection period.
term: Year Projection Period

name: Date Imputation Flag
definition: Day Imputed: Day is imputed.
term: Day Imputed

name: Date Imputation Flag
definition: Month Imputed: Month and day are imputed.
term: Month Day Imputed

name: Date Imputation Flag
definition: Year Imputed: Entire date (year, month and day) is imputed.
term: Year Month Day Imputed

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's average value over a defined set of records.
term: Average of Value Derivation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best possible outcome.
term: Best Case Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing baseline observation.
term: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best outcome recorded within a subject.
term: Best Observed Case Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous best-case non-missing value.
term: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A technique that uses assignment logic to duplicate an analysis value to be used in additional evaluations.
term: Copy Duplication Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to an estimated or assumed value based on extending a known sequence of values. This category also includes conditionally branched questions where an actual response is imputed.
term: Extrapolation Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
synonym: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to one half of the lower limit of quantification of a test.
term: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to a function of known values to estimate a value within the range.
term: Interpolation Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of detection of a test.
term: Detection Limit

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of quantification of a test.
term: Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous non-missing value.
term: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last recorded non-missing observation.
term: Last Observed Value Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last observed value prior to the start of study treatment.
term: Last Value Prior to Dosing Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.
term: Maximum Value Derivation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.
term: Minimum Value Derivation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the estimate that maximizes the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.
term: Maximum Likelihood Estimation

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
term: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
synonym: Mean Observed Value in a Group
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
term: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
synonym: Next Observation Carried Backward; Next Value Carried Backward; NVCB
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next non-missing value.
term: Next Observation Carried Backward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A technique that creates a record with a missing analysis value when there is no observed record for a given analysis visit or analysis timepoint.
term: Phantom Record Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next-to-last non-missing value.
term: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing screening observation.
term: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of detection of a test.
term: Upper Limit of Detection Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of quantification of a test.
term: Upper Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst possible outcome.
term: Worst Case Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst recorded outcome within a subject.
term: Worst Observed Case Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's worst-case non-missing observation.
term: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

name: Derivation Type
synonym: Worst Observed Value in a Group
definition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
term: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

name: Input Parameter
definition: The ratio of total births to the total population during a specified time period.
term: Birth Rate

name: Input Parameter
definition: Probability of individuals with defined demographic characteristics and tobacco use status that die in a specified time interval. (Vugrin ED, Rostron BL, Verzi SJ, Brodsky NS, Brown TJ, Choiniere CJ, Coleman BN, Paredes A, Apelberg BJ. Modeling the potential effects of new tobacco products and policies: a dynamic population model for multiple product use and harm. PLoS One. 2015 Mar 27;10(3):e0121008.)
term: Tobacco Use Status Mortality Probability

name: Input Parameter
definition: Annual number of net international migrants entering/leaving during the time interval per person in the population. (Vugrin ED, Rostron BL, Verzi SJ, Brodsky NS, Brown TJ, Choiniere CJ, Coleman BN, Paredes A, Apelberg BJ. Modeling the potential effects of new tobacco products and policies: a dynamic population model for multiple product use and harm. PLoS One. 2015 Mar 27;10(3):e0121008.)
term: Net Migration Rate

name: Input Parameter
definition: An absolute count of the number of individuals within a population group.
term: Population Count

name: Input Parameter
definition: The proportion of persons in a population who have a particular disease or attribute at a specified point in time or over a specified period of time. (CDC)
term: Prevalence

name: Input Parameter
definition: Probability of individuals with defined demographic characteristics and tobacco use status that transition their tobacco use status in the specified time interval. (Vugrin ED, Rostron BL, Verzi SJ, Brodsky NS, Brown TJ, Choiniere CJ, Coleman BN, Paredes A, Apelberg BJ. Modeling the potential effects of new tobacco products and policies: a dynamic population model for multiple product use and harm. PLoS One. 2015 Mar 27;10(3):e0121008.)
term: Tobacco Use Transition Probability

name: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Code
definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger used for analysis.
term: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger for Analysis

name: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Code
definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total score used for analysis.
term: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total Score for Analysis

name: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Name
definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total score used for analysis.
term: National Early Warning Score 2 - Total Score for Analysis

name: National Early Warning Score 2 Clinical Classification Parameter Name
definition: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger used for analysis.
term: National Early Warning Score 2 - Trigger for Analysis

name: Parameter Type
definition: Derived: Indicates that a parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.
term: Derived Flag

name: Pool for Integration
definition: The pool that includes data across all studies within which the subject has participated, used for the overall integrated analysis.
term: Overall Pooled Data

name: Subject Trial Status
definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)
term: Complete

name: Subject Trial Status
definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
term: Discontinue

name: Subject Trial Status
definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)
term: Continue

name: Time Imputation Flag
definition: Hours Imputed: Entire time (hours, minutes and seconds) is imputed.
term: Hours Minutes Seconds Imputed

name: Time Imputation Flag
definition: Minutes Imputed: Minutes and seconds are imputed.
term: Minutes Seconds Imputed

name: Time Imputation Flag
definition: Seconds Imputed: Seconds are imputed.
term: Seconds Imputed

name: Tobacco Product Category Response
definition: A tobacco product that meets the definition of the term "cigarette" in section 3(1) of the Federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act (any roll of tobacco wrapped in paper or in any substance not containing tobacco), and includes tobacco, in any form, that is functional in the product, which, because of its appearance, the type of tobacco used in the filler, or its packaging and labeling, is likely to be offered to, or purchased by, consumers as a cigarette or as roll-your-own tobacco (FD&C Act Section 900(3); 15 U.S.C. Ch. 36: CIGARETTE LABELING AND ADVERTISING). Note: The US FDA uses the term "cigarettes" to refer to combusted cigarettes, unless specifically stated otherwise. In general, the term is not meant to include any noncombusted tobacco products that meet the definition of cigarette in Section 900(3) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. Section 387(3)).
term: Cigarette

name: Tobacco Product Category Response
definition: A tobacco product that (1) is not a cigarette and (2) is a roll of tobacco wrapped in leaf tobacco or any substance containing tobacco. (FDA CTP Glossary; 26 U.S.C. Section 5702(a))
term: Cigar

name: Tobacco Product Category Response
definition: A tobacco product that is a device used to deliver e-liquid in aerosol form for inhalation. (FDA CTP Glossary)
term: Electronic Nicotine Delivery Device

name: Tobacco Product Use Status Response
definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time. (NCI)
term: Current

name: Tobacco Product Use Status Response
definition: Occurring prior to something else. (NCI)
term: Previous

name: Tobacco Product Use Status Response
definition: Not ever; at no time in the past.
term: Never

name: Tobacco Use Transition Response
definition: The act of ceasing use of a tobacco product temporarily or permanently (moving from 'Current to 'Former' tobacco product use state).
term: Tobacco Product Use Cessation

name: Tobacco Use Transition Response
definition: The act of starting use (i.e., meeting the criteria of usage) of a tobacco product that has never been used before (moving from 'Never' to 'Current' tobacco product use state).
term: Tobacco Product Use Initiation

name: Tobacco Use Transition Response
definition: The act of re-starting use of a tobacco product after a period of product use cessation (moving from 'Former' to 'Current' tobacco product use state).
term: Tobacco Product Use Relapse

name: Tobacco Use Transition Response
definition: The act of replacing one tobacco product with another.
term: Tobacco Product Use Switching
